reviews.text: This hotel is large, modern and very nice. The staff is very polite and hard working. I've stayed here a few times and have always liked it.
reviews.title: Good hotel, very over-priced for Formula1

reviews.text: I was part of a business event for the Formula1 this weekend......normally the hotel is $100-200 a night. It was $440 and you had to stay a min. of 4 nights. I think they really went over board here and gauged clients badly. In fact, the pricing and term was just embarrassing for them - staff even looked sheepish about it.
reviews.title: Almost there

reviews.text: I did like the Internet policy of 1 payment and you can connect up to 5 devices.
reviews.title: Quiet location

reviews.text: I would also comment they they have small but very nice gym.
reviews.title: Total "mixed bag" experience

reviews.text: The hotel is dated, but i am told by the front desk staff that a major refressh is slated for October-November 2012. If and when this is done this property will be much better. Even witht he dated motif and scene the hotel is situated in the middle of Austin convenient to everything. the Arboretum are is flush with eating opportunites. Within walking distance is Cheesecake factory and PF Chang's. Breakfast options include Corner bakery. the front door bellhops were courtesy and helpful. Ample parking around the building. Safe area. Target and convenience store in walking distance for supplies for those extended stays. Check in was a breeze with the friendly staff. Open and expansive with resturant in hotel along with bar.
reviews.title: Comfortable like a known pair of jeans

reviews.text: For nearly 2 years, I've stayed frequently at the Renaissance in the Arboretum for business. They have gone through some staff changes and are now renovating, and through all of this the hotel provides excellent service. I like the services like the onsite restaurant and the quiet terrace for an after work beverage. The location is good if you are doing business on the north side of town. If you time your driving right, the drive to/from the airport is a non-issue. You are close to downtown if you want to take in some local music.
reviews.title: Excellent all-around hotel in Arboretum area

reviews.text: This continues to be my preference for a hotel when I travel to Austin.
reviews.title: Very Friendly

reviews.text: Had to extend my stay for 24 hours due to illness. Hotel was incredibly accommodating and even sent up some fresh fruit to my room. Construction was not a problem at all. All staff were very kind throughout my three day stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Arboretum Location

reviews.text: This hotel is in the Marriott family and is being renovated, but I'll stay here again within a few weeks. Construction impact is minimal. As of December 2012, the front entrance is moved to a ballroom--no big deal. Looks like top two floors are closed and being worked. Note: water is shut off to some rooms mid-day. This did not impact me. Rooms are very large. Bathrooms are clean. Staff friendly and helpful. The hotel is laid out with an enclosed atrium. Biggest plus of this hotel is the location. Tons of great eating and shopping in this area. The fitness area features an indoor pool with whirlpool and sauna. This area was larger and nicer than some typical fitness centers. Note: no included breakfast.
reviews.title: Started renovations the day I checked in.

reviews.text: Great location. The hotel started major renovations the day I checked in and was never warned about this when I made the reservation. The hotel sounded like a construction site from 8am to 5pm. One night the work crews stayed late and were pounding away in the room above mine until almost 9pm. The lobby was boarded up and they had created a temporary one in a spare room/hallway. The hotel will be nice when completed but I would not recommend staying here until they have completed renovations, which the manager said should be the end of March.
reviews.title: Old and Dismal... Will not return

reviews.text: If you are traveling to North Austin and need a great hotel to take a break from your business trip or having a conference, the Renaissance Austin really does it right. The decor is older but very nice and well taken care of. The interior design of the hotel with its open atrium architecture is very unique and interesting.
reviews.title: Still a beautiful hotel!

reviews.text: Every time I go the service is impeccable and you rally can't go wrong here. The bar is enjoyable in the even and attracts an interesting crowd of travelers. Good restaurants abound nearby as well.
reviews.title: Great conference location, excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are always pleasant and helpful from the doormen to housekeeping. Rooms are clean and spacious. Great workout room, pool inside and out with ample seating. Sauna also but didn't use. Lots of great places to eat within walking distance so never ate at hotel!
reviews.title: First Timer

reviews.text: It was our first time to stay at the Renaissance in Austin. Great location to the Arboretum shopping. Walking distance to the shopping (and the Cheesecake Factory!). Very clean hotel. Nice indoor pool and hot tub. Large workout facility. The drinks at the bar were only so-so. Staff very friendly. Will probably try another hotel at the Arboretum next time given the price of this hotel. Was very quiet and bed was very comfortable. Black-out curtains worked very well.
reviews.title: Love this place

reviews.text: A large convention hotel with a huge interior atrium. Well appointed rooms, two eating options, free parking. Nestled in Austin's Arboretum with plenty of shopping and restaurants. Ask for a room with an interior balcony overlooking the atrium.
reviews.title: Great service, dated rooms

reviews.text: My small family (3) stayed at this hotel for a conference my wife had there. The rooms are fairly large. Hotel grounds and location are excellent for anyone "stuck" while a significant other is in meetings. Bakery/snack area in lobby is affordable and convenient. Hotel is attached to the Arboretum shopping center (with several dining options) and has a nice little pond with ducks and geese in a mini-nature trail. Good for a curious 4 year old - gives him something to do other than watch TV!
reviews.title: A bit dated, but a nice hotel in a nice area
Nice rooms in ok area
reviews.text: I still have issues with hotels charging for services that should be free (internet, use of business center), but they also have complimentary self-parking (just be careful not to park under a large tree - lots of birds will leave "presents" for you if you do!)
I heard staff talking about a complete renovation coming soon. That should take care of the dated feel that the hotel has. Overall, very nice staff, spacious rooms, great location - I would return!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, Average Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here five nights for a conference. The hotel personel was very nice and helpful. The rooms are large and clean, the bathroom is slightly outdated but still very clean.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great dining, helpful conference staff

reviews.text: The food that they served during breakfast and lunch was of very good quality. There are quite a lot of good quality restaurants within walking distance for dinner if you like.
reviews.title: College Visit
